scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection includes manuscript material, posters, photographs, a banner and buttons.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: August Gold was a member of the Socialist Party in New York. Gold was active in various local chapters of the Party, the cooperative movement, academic freedom, andother radical movements, mostly in the United States, from the 1930s through the 1960s.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Lillian Gold, the donor of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2002. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Lillian Gold, widow of August Gold, in 2002. The accession number 2002.034 is associated with this gift.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; August Gold Papers; TAM 295; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
